column4: hello everyone I have a localhost that is down and I can't seem to figure out how to fix it? I have looked through a lot of googled stuff but nothing seems to be helping me get it back on track?
Can someone be kind enough to give some help?
Describe the symptoms.  "Down" how?  Does it boot?  Does it not get net?
... and be patient.
yes I boot up
it comes back with where, how, doing what?
Do you mean you're not able to reach some web sites?
The localhost is not seeing anything I've tried to fix the default configuration but some where I screwed up !!!
What specific applications or commands are you running?
It's the apache2
http://www.catb.org/~esr/faqs/smart-questions.html
You're not providing me enough useful information to figure out what your problem is.
ok  here it is !

I installed the apache2 and I was trying to get /var/www moved to a Directory I created in my home Directory and I changed values in ->/etc/apache2/sites-available/default file when I rebooted and I typed localhost in the browser It said the the localhost could not be found.
So you're trying to browse "http://localhost/" from the same host?
yes
What do you see at http://127.0.0.1/ ?
wait one
same error
OK.  Can you ping localhost?
yes
yes I can ping the localhost.
are you there?
sorry, distracted.
